description: Centralized validation rules for Lexicographic Curation Workbench

R1.1.1.name: entry_id_required
R1.1.1.description: Entry ID is required and must be non-empty
R1.1.1.error_message: Entry ID is required and must be non-empty

R1.1.2.name: lexical_unit_required
R1.1.2.description: Lexical unit is required and must contain at least one language entry
R1.1.2.error_message: Lexical unit is required and must contain at least one language entry

R1.2.2.name: lexical_unit_content_validation
R1.2.2.description: Lexical unit content must be non-empty strings
R1.2.2.error_message: Lexical unit content cannot be empty or contain only whitespace

R1.1.3.name: sense_required
R1.1.3.description: At least one sense is required per entry (except for variant entries)
R1.1.3.error_message: At least one sense is required per entry

R1.2.1.name: entry_id_format
R1.2.1.description: Entry ID must match valid format pattern
R1.2.1.error_message: Invalid entry ID format. Use only letters, numbers, underscores, hyphens, and spaces

R1.2.3.name: language_code_format_validation
R1.2.3.description: Language codes must follow RFC 4646 format
R1.2.3.error_message: Invalid language code format: {value}. Must follow RFC 4646 (e.g., 'en', 'pl', 'seh-fonipa')

R2.1.1.name: sense_id_required
R2.1.1.description: Sense ID is required and must be non-empty
R2.1.1.error_message: Sense ID is required and must be non-empty

R2.1.2.name: sense_content_or_variant
R2.1.2.description: Sense definition OR gloss is required (except for variant senses)
R2.1.2.error_message: Sense must have definition, gloss, or be a variant reference

R2.2.1.name: definition_content_validation
R2.2.1.description: Sense definitions must be non-empty strings when provided (source language definitions can be empty)
R2.2.1.error_message: Sense definition cannot be empty or contain only whitespace

R2.2.2.name: gloss_content_validation
R2.2.2.description: Sense glosses must be non-empty strings when provided
R2.2.2.error_message: Sense gloss cannot be empty or contain only whitespace

R2.2.3.name: example_text_validation
R2.2.3.description: Example texts must be non-empty when example is present
R2.2.3.error_message: Example text cannot be empty or contain only whitespace

R3.1.1.name: unique_note_types
R3.1.1.description: Note types must be unique per entry
R3.1.1.error_message: Duplicate note type found. Each note type can appear only once per entry

R3.1.2.name: note_content_validation
R3.1.2.description: Note content must be non-empty when note type is specified
R3.1.2.error_message: Note content cannot be empty for specified type

R3.1.3.name: multilingual_note_structure
R3.1.3.description: Multilingual notes must follow proper language code structure
R3.1.3.error_message: Multilingual note has invalid language code structure

R4.1.2.name: ipa_character_validation
R4.1.2.description: IPA characters must be from approved character set
R4.1.2.error_message: Invalid IPA characters in pronunciation. Only approved IPA characters are allowed

R4.2.1.name: no_double_stress_markers
R4.2.1.error_message: Double stress markers not allowed in IPA pronunciation

R4.2.2.name: no_double_length_markers
R4.2.2.error_message: Double length markers not allowed in IPA pronunciation

R8.1.1.name: media_file_validation
R8.1.1.description: Media file references must point to existing files

R8.1.2.name: illustration_file_validation
R8.1.2.description: Illustration file references must point to existing files

R6.1.1.name: entry_sense_pos_consistency
R6.1.1.description: If entry has POS and senses have POS, they must be consistent
R6.1.1.error_message: Part-of-speech inconsistency between entry and senses

R6.1.2.name: conflicting_sense_pos_manual_entry
R6.1.2.description: If senses have conflicting POS values, entry POS must be set manually
R6.1.2.error_message: Conflicting sense POS values require manual entry-level POS

R8.2.1.name: rfc4646_language_format
R8.2.1.description: Language codes must follow RFC 4646 format
R8.2.1.error_message: Invalid language code format. Must follow RFC 4646 (e.g., 'en', 'seh-fonipa', 'pt-BR')

R8.2.2.name: unique_language_codes_multitext
R8.2.2.description: Language codes must be unique per multitext content
R8.2.2.error_message: Duplicate language code in multitext content

R8.3.1.name: iso_date_format
R8.3.1.description: Date formats must be valid ISO dates
R8.3.1.error_message: Invalid date format. Use ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD or full datetime)

R8.5.1.name: abbreviation_expansion_length
R8.5.1.error_message: Suspicious {relation_type} relation: target length suggests reversed relationship

R8.5.2.name: synonym_antonym_exclusion
R8.5.2.description: Entry cannot have both synonym and antonym relations to same target
R8.5.2.error_message: Conflicting relations: entry has both synonym and antonym relations to same target

R8.7.1.name: subsense_depth_limit
R8.7.1.description: Subsense nesting should not exceed 3 levels
R8.7.1.error_message: Subsense nesting exceeds maximum depth of 3 levels

validate_sense_content_or_variant.description: Validates that sense has definition, gloss, or variant reference

validate_unique_note_types.description: Validates that note types are unique within entry

validate_file_exists.description: Validates that referenced file exists on file system

validate_unique_languages_in_multitext.description: Validates unique language codes in multitext content

validate_multilingual_note_structure.description: Validates multilingual note language codes against project settings

validate_pos_consistency.description: Validates part-of-speech consistency between entry and senses

validate_conflicting_pos.description: Validates that conflicting sense POS requires manual entry POS

validate_definition_content_source_lang_.description: Validates definition content with exception for source language
